bill_title: authorize transportation activities by air ambulance services.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to authorize transportation activities by air ambulance services. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 34-11: An air ambulance service may use a ground ambulance to transport a patient between: (1) An acute care hospital and the airport at which the service maintains its ordinary and usual place of business; and (2) The airport at which the air ambulance service maintains its ordinary and usual place of business and an acute care hospital. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 34-11: An air ambulance service may utilize the service's ground ambulance for a non-emergent transfer of a patient from one healthcare facility to another healthcare facility if: (1) The patient's attending medical practitioner determines that the patient requires a level of care that is not available without a transfer; (2) The use of an air ambulance is precluded due to: (a) Mechanical issues; or (b) Weather issues; and (3) The area's primary ambulance service provider is first given the opportunity to transport the patient and is unable to begin the transport: (a) Within thirty minutes; or (b) Within the period of time approved by the patient's attending medical practitioner.
